content.description:
“What is the phenomenon of globalization...? Fundamentally, it is the closer integration of the countries and peoples of the world which has been brought about by the enormous reduction of costs of transportation . . . and the breaking down of artificial barriers to the flow of goods, services, capital, knowledge, and (to a lesser extent) people across borders.”

Joseph E. Stiglitz, economist, Globalization and Its Discontents, 2002
content.question: Which of the following earlier trends was most similar to the pattern described in the excerpt?

choices.label: The development of Atlantic world commerce in the 1600s and early 1700s
The appearance of economic cycles in the early 1800s
The restrictions on immigration in the latter half of the 1800s
The increases in worldwide tariffs during the Great Depression

content.answer: The development of Atlantic world commerce in the 1600s and early 1700s

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
